title: Source: Commanders to hire Vikes' Jones as DC
content: The Commanders are finalizing a deal to hire Vikings pass game coordinator Daronte Jones as their next defensive coordinator, a source said.

title: No. 1 Arizona survives BYU to stay undefeated
content: Brayden Burries scored 29 points and made the game-saving block in the final seconds as No. 1 Arizona held off a furious rally from No. 13 BYU.

title: Gauff caught in 'private' moment smashing racket
content: Coco Gauff, a 3-seed and two-time major winner, struggled with her serve and recorded five double faults in the first set, when she was broken four times, and was ousted by Elina Svitolina.

title: Win moves Alcaraz closer to career Grand Slam
content: In his first semifinal in Australia, Carlos Alcaraz will next take on Alexander Zverev after getting past Alex de Minaur on Tuesday.

title: Bediako hearing delayed; NCAA wants new judge
content: Charles Bediako can continue playing for Alabama after a hearing on his request for a preliminary injunction was delayed. Meanwhile, the NCAA has filed a motion asking the judge overseeing the case to recuse himself, AL.com reported.

title: Reports: ICE agents to have security role at Milan
content: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents will have a security role during the Winter Games in Milan, according to multiple reports Tuesday.

title: Stanford, family of Katie Meyer reach settlement
content: Stanford announced a settlement with the family of Katie Meyer, the former star soccer goalkeeper and two-time team captain who died by suicide in 2022.

title: Ex-FIFA prez backs call to 'stay away' from WC
content: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter on Monday backed a proposed fan boycott of World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Donald Trump and his administration at home and abroad.

title: Four offseason lessons from two unlikely Super Bowl teams: Savvy moves for the Seahawks, Patriots
content: It's easy to be skeptical about big free agency spending, midtier QB contracts and defensive-minded coaches. But the Seahawks and Patriots proved everyone wrong.

title: First look at Seahawks-Patriots: Early Super Bowl picks, big questions, key matchups
content: Ahead of the Feb. 8 showdown, we have predictions, matchup insight, looming questions and team breakdowns.

title: Top 100 MLB prospects for 2026: This year's No. 1 is in a tier of his own
content: Where do stars of tomorrow such as Konnor Griffin and Kevin McGonigle land as we rank baseball's best young players?

title: NBA trade deadline primer: 30 teams, 30 outlooks ahead of Feb. 5
content: What deals could kick-start the NBA trade deadline? Bobby Marks examines the players, picks and priorities you need to know for all 30 teams.

title: Women's Bracketology: How a new metric will help (or hurt) bubble teams
content: Understanding wins above bubble helps explain why Virginia, which has a 37 NET ranking, is on the outside looking in.

title: Sizing up Stafford vs. Maye for MVP: Which star quarterback should win the award?
content: It's a two-player race for NFL MVP. We made cases for quarterbacks Matthew Stafford and Drake Maye to win the award -- then our experts made their picks.

title: Connelly's best 100 games of the 2025 college football season
content: From CFP (and FCS playoff) classics to OT thrillers and what-the-heck moments, this season had it all.

title: Inside Sean Payton's fourth-down Patriots-Broncos call
content: Behind the scenes with Denver Broncos coach Sean Payton, before and after his failed fourth-down decision.

title: The three key factors that helped the Avalanche turn into a juggernaut
content: Colorado is flirting with NHL records for team performance. We dive deep on the NHL's most dominant team.

title: WWE 'Raw' results: Finn Balor attacks CM Punk, Bron Breakker returns
content: Andreas Hale breaks down all the action from the last episode of "Raw" before Saturday's Royal Rumble.

title: The Premier League stars who could still move this transfer window
content: There is less than a week left of the January transfer window. Here are the Premier League players who still need a move away this month.

title: As 'managers' disappear from the Premier League, are clubs better off?
content: Premier League clubs are corporations that have outgrown the "manager" role that legendary Arsenal and Man United clubs once had. Why?

title: Fantasy baseball: Quartet of shortstops leads top-10 prospects to consider for 2026
content: Eric Karabell outlines the prospects most likely to have an impact on the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

title: Get ready for the Senior Bowl: Six predictions and 15 NFL draft prospects to watch in Mobile
content: Our NFL draft experts weigh in on what to expect at the Senior Bowl, from picking out position groups to watch to predicting players who could rise.

title: My first bet for Super Bowl LX: Back Seattle's offense in a high-scoring matchup
content: It's time for the biggest sports betting event of the year. Here's your first betting guide to Super Bowl LX.

title: 'Uptown Funk,' 'Creed' and more trends from Seahawks' last Super Bowl berth
content: The Seahawks are headed to the big game for the first time since 2015. Here are the that year's biggest trends.

title: Ranking this weekend's fights: From Lopez-Shakur to Zayas-Baraou
content: Nick Parkinson ranks the weekend's fights from best to worst and breaks down what's at stake in each matchup.

title: Did film producer forge phone call records of a financier, judge and court staff?: Madras High Court orders police inquiry
content: Justice Sunder Mohan directs Chennai Cyber Crime cell to find out whether the phone call records were genuine or forged

title: ASI team to inspect Nagalapuram temple gopuram in early February
content: The team will identify measures for technical evaluation, scientific preservation, restoration and long-term protection of the structure

title: Apolitical movement begins in support of Bedti-Varada river-linking project
content: Decision taken to set up committee led by seers to meet the Chief Minister, the Deputy Chief Minister and Union Ministers from the State

title: A.P. CM sets 50 million MT horticulture output target for Rayalaseema, Prakasam
content: Pending irrigation projects requiring minimal funds must be undertaken on a priority, says Naidu; officials told to prepare plans to rebuild the damaged Annamayya project

title: Madikeri CMC cracks down on stray cattle on roads
content: The CMC Commissioner has set February 6 as the deadline for cattle owners to voluntarily restrain and control their cattle

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: 40 soldiers among 60 rescued from snowbound stretch in J&K’s Doda after being stranded
content: The BRO successfully carried out the high-altitude rescue and road restoration operation under Project Sampark at Chatergala Pass situated at an altitude of 10,500 ft in the Bhaderwah-Chatergala axis, a defence spokesperson said

title: A.P. Minister launches ‘Drugs pai Dandayatra’ in NTR district
content: Five women police officers, as part of a special drive launched by the NTR police, will organise a 500-km cycle rally over 35 days with the objective of creating public awareness about the ill effects of ganja and other drugs.

title: Government that disappoints followers of Sanatan Dharma will never return to power: Amit Shah
content: Amit Shah said that followers of various Sanatan traditions waited for a long time after Independence, hoping for a government that would give due importance to Sanatan Dharma and govern as per its principles

title: CESC to add 600 MW power by March; major infrastructure works under way
content: Under the KUSUM-C scheme, steps have been initiated to generate 900 MW of power within the CESC limits

title: Kerala to become India’s first State with a comprehensive urban policy: Minister M.B. Rajesh
content: The State’s urban population increased from 26.44% in 1991 to 47.22% in 2011; estimates indicate that it could reach 80% by 2051

title: Mamata forcefully taking on BJP at national level, says Akhilesh Yadav after meeting her
content: Mr. Yadav met Mamata Banerjee at the State Secretariat Nabanna amid a charged political atmosphere in the poll-bound State over the controversial SIR exercise, and lauded her for ‘courage in countering the BJP’s onslaughts’

title: Nirmala Sitharaman takes part in customary halwa ceremony; marks final stage of Budget preparation
content: The ‘Halwa ceremony’ precedes the ‘lock-in’ of the officials involved in preparation of the Union Budget

title: Modi government wants to push country back to era of ‘maharajas’: Rahul slams MGNREGA repeal
content: The Congress has been demanding that the government withdraw the new Viksit Bharat - Guarantee for Rozgar Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) or VB-G RAM G Act and fully restore the UPA-era MGNREGA

title: Protest march held in Kolkata over people’s ‘harassment’ during Bengal SIR
content: The procession by Jamiat-e-Ulama-e-Hind began in the Rajabazar area of north-central Kolkata and culminated at Esplanade in the central part of the city, covering a distance of about 4.5 km

title: Uttar Pradesh inked deals worth ₹3 lakh crore at WEF in Davos: State Finance Minister Khanna
content: “This is a major achievement for Uttar Pradesh and reflects the confidence global investors have in the State," Uttar Pradesh Finance Minister Khanna said

title: Process on to impeach Justice Varma, govt awaiting probe panel report: Kiren Rijiju
content: Justice Varma was repatriated from the Delhi High Court to the Allahabad High Court after burnt wads of currency notes were found at his official residence here on March 14

title: European Council President Antonio Costa remembers India connection
content: “I am the President of the European Council but I am also an overseas Indian citizen... for me, it has a special meaning. I am very proud of my roots in Goa, where my father’s family came from. The connection between Europe and India is something personal to me,” Mr. Costa said

title: Labour Codes: Kerala govt. will not implement any anti-worker measures, says Sivankutty
content: To a calling attention motion moved by Ponnani MLA P. Nandakumar, Sivankutty says the issue of Labour Codes was of critical importance as it affected crores of workers nationwide.

title: Student group protests outside UGC office in Delhi, demands complete rollback of equity rules
content: Amid heavy barricading and rain, around 100 students participated in the protest; the group submitted a list of demands to the UGC, including a complete rollback of the regulations

title: Shivamogga DISHA committee adopts resolution in support of VB - G RAM G
content: This decision of the DISHA gains significance in the wake of the opposition of the government of Karnataka to replacing the MGNREGA with the VB-G RAM G

title: Vishwakarma scheme ensures self employment opportunities quickly: BJP leader Ramesh Yadav
content: The scheme which was launched by the Union Government to benefit carpenters, blacksmiths, goldsmiths, potters, artisans, masons

title: Convicted Kerala CPI(M) councillor accused of parole violation after joining Payyannur protest
content: V.K. Nishad was seen participating in a CPI(M) protest held at Payyannur on Monday against expelled party leader V. Kunhikrishnan

title: Sangeethabhushan Award given away
content: The event marked the commemoration of Subramania Bhagavathar, one of the foremost disciples of the legendary Carnatic musician Chembai Vaidyanatha Bhagavathar.

title: Maharashtra cabinet approves Metro project to link Mumbai and Navi Mumbai airports
content: The corridor will have 20 stations, including six underground and 14 elevated stations. Land acquisition for the project, covering 30.7 hectares, is expected to cost ₹388 crore

title: Colonial building at Government Botanical Garden in Nilgiris converted into museum
content: Tourists are now allowed to visit the museum, where old photographs of the garden, detailing its founding and the changes it underwent over the past two centuries, have been exhibited

title: Kerala court detains Congress MP Shafi Parambil, fines him ₹1,000 in NH blockade case
content: Palakkad court issued an arrest warrant against Shafi Parambil last week after he repeatedly failed to appear before it. Vadakara MP then appeared before the court on Tuesday, following which he was detained until the court is adjourned at 5 p.m.

title: Dhinakaran sees scope for coalition government, Cabinet berths for AMMK
content: “Political pundits say the current political situation in Tamil Nadu favoured a coalition government, and there is a chance that we will be accommodated in the AIADMK Cabinet,” Mr. Dhinakaran told journalists in Madurai

title: Government aims to make 3-nanometre chips by 2032; achieve self-reliance in 75% tech categories in 4 years
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said the government wants to focus on six major systems "so that we develop our complete semiconductor design ecosystem in a very comprehensive way"

title: Bank employees stage protest in Shivamogga demanding five-day work week
content: They claimed that the Central Government had not approved this demand, which prompted bank employees to hit the streets

title: Akhilesh Yadav meets Mamata Banerjee at West Bengal secretariat
content: “Only ‘Didi’ (Mamata Banerjee) can counter the onslaught of the BJP in this country,” said Akhilesh Yadav

title: R-Day feast served to school children on scraps of paper in Madhya Pradesh; govt orders action
content: The video shows students sitting on the floor and eating halwa-puri served to them on torn pages from old notebooks and book

title: 153 tribal students in T.N. secure admissions to premier institutions
content: S. Annadurai, Director, Tribal Welfare Department, reaffirmed the government’s commitment to improving access to higher education for tribal students

title: New plant species recorded in Nagaland community forest
content: The researchers noted that Hoya Nagaensis found in Phek district faces a threat from shifting cultivation, which involves slashing, burning trees on hill slopes for cultivation

title: Nirmala Sitharaman to make history with ninth consecutive budget
content: This will take Ms. Sitharaman closer to the record of 10 budgets that were presented by former Prime Minister Morarji Desai over different time periods

title: T.N. BJP plans micro-level outreach through suggestion boxes, online portal for election manifesto inputs
content: Speaking to The Hindu, senior BJP leader Tamilisai Soundararajan, who is heading the 13-member panel to draft the party’s election manifesto, said at the first meeting of the panel held recently, it was decided to elicit the opinions and needs of the people Assembly segment-wise

title: India-EU FTA likely to make premium luxury cars less expensive
content: The EU will eliminate duty in a phased manner for Indian automobiles, whereas India will reduce the levies to 10% for specified numbers

title: Bengaluru police register suo motu case after woman alleges harassment by ‘naked’ man in car
content: In a video which went viral on social media, the woman is heard shouting for help and accusing passersby of ignoring her distress

title: Lok Bhavan chalo: All Gram Panchayat offices in Karnataka to be named after Mahatma Gandhi
content: The announcement came at the Congress protest against Union government introducing the VB-G Ram G Act by repealing the MGNREGA; Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakuamr court arrest

title: How an NGO’s initiative is helping parents in T.N. villages support children’s early development
content: Initiated in 2014 in five villages in Gummidipoondi, with assistance from Michelin Tyres, the programme sought to raise awareness among parents about child and brain development.

title: Supreme Court refuses to entertain plea against ‘VIP darshan’ at Ujjain Mahakal temple
content: The petitioner argued that there ought to be a uniform policy, especially about entering the garbh-garha (sanctum sanctorum)

title: India-EU FTA — Mother of All Deals: Highlights
content: The talks for the pact were concluded on Friday (January 23), and it was approved by the Union Cabinet on Saturday (January 24)

title: BJP-JDS legislators stage dharna in front of Mahatma Gandhi statue in Bengaluru seeking resignation of Excise Minister, action against those who ‘misbehaved’ with Karnataka Governor
content: The opposition combine declared that they would continue to fight till Excise Minister resigns over corruption charges

title: Uttar Pradesh government suspends Bareilly city magistrate Alankar Agnihotri; orders inquiry
content: As per the official order, Alankar Agnihotri has been found prima facie guilty of indiscipline based on a report submitted by the district magistrate of Bareilly

title: Watch: The Hindu Editorial | On India’s 77th Republic Day and the President’s speech
content: On the eve of India’s 77th Republic Day, President Droupadi Murmu reflected on the country’s democratic journey, highlighting self-reliance, national achievements, and India’s role as a messenger of peace and stability.

title: Jharkhand industrialist's son rescued from Hazaribag two weeks after abduction
content: "He was safely rescued by the Jamshedpur Police on January 27, and sent home around 4:30 a.m.,” says SP (City) Kumar Sivashish

title: Deepak death case: Kerala court denies bail to accused Shimjitha
content: Delivering the ruling, Magistrate agrees with prosecution that investigation was progressing and that releasing the accused could lead to evidence tampering and influence over witnesses

title: Second spell of snowfall in Uttarakhand high-altitude areas
content: Cloudy conditions prevailed in Gangotri and Yamunotri and surrounding areas in Uttarkashi district, while the weather remained dry in Dehradun and other plains areas

title: Plea challenges new UGC Regulations, asks why quota only for SC/ST/OBC
content: The plea, filed by Vineet Jindal, said the new UGC Regulations argued that an exclusionary, asymmetric and caste-specific definition of ‘caste-based discrimination’ denied equal protection of law to a substantial section of citizens solely on the basis of caste

title: School teacher held for raising slogans in support of Jinnah during Republic Day event in Bihar
content: A purported video of the incident went viral on social media, in which students are seen responding "amar rahe (long live)" to the call "Jinnah" by the accused teacher.

title: Invest in India’s energy sector; offers $500 bn investment opportunity: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister said "India is a land of opportunities for the energy sector as demand is continuously increasing … India will soon become the world's largest oil refining hub”

title: Kerala Assembly: Opposition walks out as Speaker rejects adjournment motion on Payyannur martyr fund row, political violence
content: Speaker declines to admit adjournment motion under Rule 50 after ruling that the issue did not meet the urgency required to suspend House proceedings for detailed discussion. Satheesan alleges decision was taken ‘under government pressure’ to avoid discussion on an issue that puts CPI(M) on the defensive

title: All-party meet: Govt turns down Opposition demands for discussion on VB-G RAM G Act, SIR during Budget Session
content: The first part of the session will continue till February 13 during which the Motion of Thanks will be discussed  and passed

title: India has formally inked ‘mother of all deals’ FTA with E.U., informs PM Modi
content: Speaking at the inauguration of the India Energy Week, PM Modi also enumerated about investment potential in oil and gas as well as the overall energy sector

title: Elderly man beaten to death over ‘witchcraft’ suspicion in Jharkhand’s Palamu
content: “The incident occurred at Chhanka village in Manatu police station area on January 26, said. The deceased has been identified as Faguni Bhuiyan,” says police

title: Indian Oil to raise Brazilian crude purchases as Russian imports slow, executive says
content: Indian refiners are considering importing Venezuelan crude, which is being offered by Vitol and Trafigura under a ⁠U.S. mandated sale

title: 200 more stray dogs killed in Telangana’s Pathipaka village
content: A complaint lodged on Monday alleges the dogs were killed about a month ago. The latest complaint was included with the FIR already registered over deaths of 300 stray dogs in two Hanamkonda villages.

title: China halts sale of Sun Pharma drug used to treat dementia
content: The National Medical Products ​Administration said a recent remote ⁠inspection found shortcomings in the company’s production processes, including in the ​prevention of ⁠contamination anfulfilmentd the quality management department’s fulfillment of duties.

title: ‘Jana Nayagan’ censor row: Madras High Court sets aside single judge’s order that favoured actor Vijay’s film
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan remand the matter back to the single judge for a fresh hearing of the writ petition

title: CPI(M) in Kerala expels V. Kunhikrishnan over martyrs’ fund allegations
content: CPI(M) Kannur district secretary K.K. Ragesh says Kunhikrishnan has “acted as a tool in the hands of party enemies” by repeating issues that had already been settled by the district committee in April 2022

title: India-EU FTA: Rs 6.4 lakh crore export boost for us, says Piyush Goyal
content: India and the European Union have inked a historic Free Trade Agreement after two decades of talks, boosting bilateral economic ties amid global uncertainty. This comprehensive pact grants India unprecedented market access for over 99% of its exports to the EU, significantly benefiting labour-intensive sectors and MSMEs, while also enhancing services and mobility for professionals.

title: 'Turmoil in global environment': PM Modi's 'double engine' pitch after India-EU 'historic' FTA
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a historic free trade agreement between India and the European Union, emphasizing a "double engine" growth approach amid global turmoil. This "biggest free trade agreement" aims to provide stability and common prosperity, unlocking new opportunities for India's labor-intensive products and service sectors.

title: 'Aye! Who's screaming DK, DK': Sidda loses cool as youth leaders chant DKS slogans
content: Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah lost his temper at a rally when Youth Congress workers chanted slogans for deputy CM DK Shivakumar. Despite his requests for quiet, the disruptions continued, overshadowing the protest against a new rural employment scheme. This incident highlights the ongoing power struggle between the two leaders within the state Congress.

title: After cheating claims by Smriti Mandhana's friend, Palash Muchhal spotted outside court
content: Music composer Palash Muchhal has filed a Rs 10 crore criminal defamation case against Marathi actor-producer Vidnyan Mane. Mane had accused Muchhal of cheating and financial fraud amounting to over Rs 40 lakh, claims the composer refutes as baseless and damaging to his reputation.

title: 'He deserves another chance': Ex-India captain's message to Agarkar over Sarfaraz
content: Sarfaraz Khan is making a strong case for a return to the Indian team with exceptional domestic performances after a period of transformation. His recent prolific run-scoring, including a 227 in the Ranji Trophy, has garnered attention. Encouragement from former captain Mohammad Azharuddin, who praised his attacking intent and desire to learn, further bolsters his prospects for another opportunity.

title: Infosys tightens its Work from Home policy, adds new conditions to …
content: Infosys has reportedly tightened its work-from-home policy, capping extra remote days at five per quarter, with exceptions for critical medical needs. This follows similar moves by TCS and Wipro amid industry shifts. Employees at lower levels must now attend the office at least ten days monthly. The company's stance contrasts with earlier statements on flexibility.

title: BAFTA 2026: 'One Battle After Another' leads; see full list of nominations
content: The excitement is palpable as the 2026 BAFTA nominations have just been announced! Leading the charge is Paul Thomas Anderson's compelling drama 'One Battle After Another' with an impressive 14 nominations, while the intense narrative of Ryan Coogler's 'Sinners' follows closely behind with 13 nods. These awards shine a spotlight on the incredible creativity in both British and international films.

title: 'Remove your perfume & tie your hair': Historian recounts 'strange' experience at this Delhi tomb
content: Historian Eric Chopra explores Delhi's haunted sites, focusing on the enigmatic tomb of Jamali and Kamali.  Despite local warnings of djinns, Chopra experienced a profound sense of peace and love within the tomb, highlighting the enduring power of bonds that transcend death.

title: Microsoft and Amazon together take out a full-page ad; point to 'emergency' in Washington
content: Tech giants Microsoft and Amazon, usually fierce rivals, have united to address Washington State's housing crisis.  The companies jointly penned an Op-Ed and took out a full-page ad, highlighting their $1.6 billion commitment to affordable housing. They urge policymakers to simplify building regulations to combat the severe shortage.

title: Protests, PIL and campus pushback: Why UGC's equity rules have opened a can of worms
content: UGC’s 2026 equity regulations, notified January 13, have triggered student protests from Delhi to Lucknow, political heat, and a Supreme Court PIL targeting Regulation 3(1)(c). It defines caste-based discrimination as discrimination against SC, ST and OBC members. Protesters fear misuse, burden-of-proof issues and “surveillance” via Equity Squads, while the Centre says misuse won’t be allowed and clarifications are coming soon.

title: No tariffs on gems, jewellery, plastic: How will ‘mother of all deals’ with EU benefit India — Explained
content: The European Union ranks among India’s largest trading partners. The bilateral trade between the two in goods and services has risen steadily in recent years.

title: OpenAI VP Matt Knight shares resignation note on X; CEO Sam Altman replies
content: OpenAI's Chief Information Security Officer, Matt Knight, has stepped down after over five years. Knight, the company's first security hire in 2020, oversaw the growth of its security program to protect a global platform used by millions. He expressed pride in defining AI security and launching the Aardvark project. CEO Sam Altman lauded Knight's significant contributions.

title: India-EU trade deal sealed: Why won't FTA be signed today?
content: India and the European Union have concluded talks for a free trade agreement. This landmark deal promises expanded market access for Indian exports and lower tariffs for EU goods. The agreement will now undergo legal review and ratification. Formal signing is anticipated later this year, with implementation likely in early 2027.

title: Gujarat man escaped from Nepal jail during Gen Z protests; arrested in Ahmedabad
content: An Indian national from Gujarat, Dharmesh Chunara, who escaped from Nepal's Bhadra Jail during last year's "Gen Z" protests, has been apprehended by Ahmedabad Police. He was caught with 13 kilograms of hybrid ganja valued at approximately Rs 13 crore. Chunara had entered India via the Sonauli border after the jailbreak.

title: 'Politics should be eradicated': Ex-Pak cricketer issues blunt warning to world cricket
content: Former Pakistan spinner Saqlain Mushtaq has strongly criticized the intrusion of politics into cricket, asserting it harms both the sport and humanity. He emphasized cricket's role in fostering unity, lamenting the prolonged absence of India-Pakistan bilateral series. Mushtaq believes politics is detrimental, turning cricket into a battleground instead of entertainment.

title: Office romance ends in murder: Lover beheads HR manager, dumps body in gunny bag
content: An HR manager was brutally murdered and dismembered by her lover in Agra. The accused, Vinay Singh, allegedly killed the victim, Minky Sharma, after a dispute over her contact with another man. He confessed to the crime and has been arrested, with efforts underway to recover the victim's head.

title: 'Border 2' box office collection day 5: Movie inches towards Rs 180 crore
content: Border 2 has achieved exceptional box office success over its opening weekend, driven by strong performances on Saturday, Sunday, and Republic Day. The film garnered a massive Rs 59 crore on Monday, with mass belts and Tier-2/Tier-3 centers showing extraordinary results, leading to a total collection of Rs 179.23 crore in just five days.

title: Union Budget 2026–27 to be presented on Feb 1: Here’s when and where to watch
content: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget for the financial year 2026–27 in Parliament on Sunday.  It is a statement of the government’s estimated receipts and expenditures for the coming year.  The budget will be broadcasted live on Sansad TV, DD News and TOI will provide live coverage.

title: 'Can't accommodate ... ': ICC on 80–90 Bangladeshi applications for T20 World Cup
content: The ICC is revising its media accreditation for Bangladeshi journalists after the team's withdrawal from the T20 World Cup due to security concerns. Several journalists reported rejections, prompting the ICC to rework the process. The Bangladesh Cricket Board is seeking clarification from the ICC on the accreditation changes.

title: India-EU FTA sealed: Will BMWs and Mercedes be more affordable?
content: India's new Free Trade Agreement with the EU promises lower import duties on European cars, potentially making luxury brands more accessible. However, the benefits are primarily for higher-income buyers, as concessions apply to pricier vehicles. While mass affordability for the average middle class remains distant, the deal could spur local manufacturing and technological advancements in India's auto sector.

title: Row over Shankaracharya Avimukteshwaranand: Officer resigns in UP over 'insult' to CM & PM
content: A Uttar Pradesh GST Deputy Commissioner in Ayodhya, Prashant Kumar Singh, has resigned citing moral reasons and support for CM Yogi Adityanath and PM Narendra Modi. Singh stated he was deeply hurt by allegations against the leaders and felt it was his duty to take a stand. He plans to engage in social work after his resignation is accepted.

title: 'You're like Yuvraj Singh': Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's priceless reaction to kid fan goes viral
content: Young batting sensation Vaibhav Sooryavanshi is making waves at the Under-19 World Cup, recently smashing a 24-ball half-century against Zimbabwe. The Rajasthan Royals prodigy, compared to Yuvraj Singh by fans, has scored 166 runs in four matches, showcasing his explosive and fearless batting.

title: ‘Just quit ...’: Rahul opens up on injuries, mental battles & cricket's next chapter
content: KL Rahul acknowledges his career hasn't fully met expectations but has found stability as India's reliable No. 5 ODI batter. He discussed retirement pragmatically, highlighting the mental toll of injuries as the toughest challenge. Rahul emphasised a balanced perspective, especially after becoming a father, seeing life beyond cricket. He's now set for domestic duty with Karnataka.

title: India-EU FTA: European beer, cars and food to get cheaper — details of the trade deal
content: India-EU FTA concluded: India and the European Union have finalized a landmark free trade agreement, dubbed the 'mother of all deals,' creating a vast economic zone. This pact promises significant benefits, including cheaper European cars and food for Indians, and duty-free access for Indian textiles and leather. The deal, concluded after 18 years, aims to boost trade and strengthen strategic ties.

title: BJP vs Cong: Rahul stirs row over ‘Gamosa’ at President’s ‘at home’ reception
content: Both parties trained guns at one another after the BJP alleged that Rahul Gandhi refused to wear the traditional Assamese scarf given to all the guests at a reception hosted by President Droupadi Murmu. BJP called it an insult to the northeast, with Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma snubbing what he called the attitude of the "de facto supremo".

title: UGC rules, Magh Mela snub: What pushed Bareilly city magistrate to quit on Republic Day
content: Bareilly City Magistrate Alankar Agnihotri resigned, citing deep disagreement with UGC regulations he deemed divisive and a threat to academic harmony. He alleged the new rules could foment caste discontent and lead to atrocities against Brahmins. Agnihotri also claimed he was held hostage at the District Magistrate's residence, allegations refuted by the DM. Political leaders expressed concern over administrative pressure.

title: All WWE 2K26 Editions, price details, bonus rewards, pre-order, and more
content: WWE 2K26 is set for an early March 2026 release, boasting ambitious special editions celebrating wrestling eras like Attitude and Monday Night War. Pre-orders open January 30, 2026. Expect new match types, potential CM Punk Showcase content, and a narrative-driven Island mode featuring Roman Reigns. Premium editions offer early access.

title: Wheelchair-bound soldier harassed at Karnataka toll plaza; viral video prompts apology
content: Sasthan toll plaza staff apologized after an ex-serviceman, a war casualty, was allegedly harassed over toll payment despite presenting exemption documents. The incident, captured in a viral video, led to staff sensitization by police. The ex-serviceman has not pressed charges.

title: Trapped in snow while filming reels: Chamba teens’ final hours and a dog that stayed behind
content: Two young relatives, drawn by a passion for social media reels, embarked on a journey to the snow-laden Barmani range, tragically losing their lives to a severe blizzard. Despite a yellow alert and challenging conditions, their adventure turned into a heartbreaking ordeal, culminating in a difficult rescue operation and the recovery of both bodies.

title: Snowfall shuts Srinagar airport: 58 flights cancelled; tourists stranded after holiday weekend
content: Srinagar International Airport cancelled all flights on Tuesday due to continuous snowfall, rendering the runway unsafe for operations. Airport authorities are monitoring the weather, with 58 flights affected. Hundreds of tourists are stranded as they await improved conditions for flight resumption.

title: Nationwide bank strike: Why unions are protesting; 10 things to know
content: Public sector banks across India are experiencing widespread disruption due to a nationwide strike called by the United Forum of Bank Unions (UFBU). Employees are demanding the immediate implementation of a five-day work week, a request that remains unformalised by the government. The strike is expected to impact branch services for five consecutive days, compounded by upcoming holidays.

title: Pakistan-origin player in squad: Scotland confident visas will clear for T20 WC in India
content: Cricket Scotland's CEO is confident players will reach India for the T20 World Cup despite visa delays, especially for Pakistan-origin pacer Safyaan Sharif.  The ICC and BCCI are working to expedite the process for all 20 teams, with Scotland's opening match on February 7th.  Scotland is also preparing backup visa applications.

title: ‘Accident’ that wasn’t: Bengaluru techie crashes SUV twice to finish off friend
content: A drunken argument between friends escalated into a brutal murder in Electronics City. Roshan Hegde, a software engineer, intentionally crashed his SUV twice, killing his friend Prashanth M who was clinging to the vehicle. Dashcam footage revealed the deliberate act, initially mistaken for a road accident. The dispute stemmed from a cricket match and alcohol consumption.

title: Oncologist reveals why breast cancer is rising in women under 40
content: Breast cancer is affecting younger women more frequently. This trend is a growing concern in India and globally. Many young women dismiss symptoms, believing cancer only affects older individuals. Early detection is crucial for better survival rates. Awareness campaigns must include women under 40 to encourage timely medical consultation and improve outcomes.

title: Silver jumps almost 6%, gold breaks beyond $5,100: What is driving precious metals?
content: Gold and silver futures shattered previous records on Tuesday, driven by a surge in safe-haven demand amidst escalating geopolitical tensions.  International markets saw significant gains, with gold surpassing $5,100 per ounce and silver climbing over 6%.  This rally is attributed to global uncertainty, a weakening US dollar, and trade disputes impacting currency values.

title: Gurgaon cops in hot pursuit, SUV stalled in mud: How 23-yr-old endured Leopard Trail abduction ordeal
content: A 23-year-old woman was abducted from Leopard Trail by a food vendor who forced her into a borrowed Scorpio. Police pursued the vehicle for an hour before it got stuck, leading to the vendor's arrest. He faces charges of kidnapping and snatching, with potential sexual assault charges pending.

title: Bank strike today: Are public sector banks open for customers?
content: Public sector bank operations face nationwide disruption Tuesday as unions strike for a five-day work week. Conciliation talks failed, leading to the strike after banks were already closed for the weekend and Republic Day. This is expected to impact branch services for three consecutive days.

title: ‘Just getting started’: Hardik Pandya shares nostalgic video on 10-year India journey
content: Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya celebrated a decade in international cricket, marking the milestone with an emotional message on Instagram. He expressed gratitude for his journey, emphasising that his career is far from over and that he is just beginning his true path. Pandya highlighted his growth as a cricketer and a man while serving his country.

title: Shankaracharya vs Yogi Adityanath Escalates, Ayodhya Bureaucrat Resigns
content: In a sharp escalation of the row involving Shankaracharya Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati and Yogi Adityanath, an Ayodhya bureaucrat has resigned, saying he is doing this in support of the Uttar Pradesh chief minister, the PM and the Constitution.

title: "Who Are Those Shouting 'DK, DK'?" Siddaramaiah Loses Cool At Rally
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Tuesday lost his cool and shouted at some Youth Congress workers who started raising slogans in favour of Deputy CM D K Shivakumar during a protest rally in the city.

title: European Carmakers Eye Expansion In India Amid Suzuki, Homegrown Domination
content: European carmakers, squeezed by U.S. tariffs and price wars in China, will get a welcome boost from an EU-India trade deal that sharply drops tariffs on car imports, but face a tough market dominated by homegrown firms and compact Japanese "kei cars.

title: India-EU Pact Boosts Economic Confidence Of Traders, Artisans: Traders' Body
content: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has welcomed the landmark India-European Union Free Trade Agreement (FTA), calling it a historic breakthrough that could reshape India's trade landscape.

title: How Bangladesh's Jamaat-e-Islami Is Undergoing Image Makeover Ahead Of Polls
content: The Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami is betting big on the upcoming election in Bangladesh on February 12, amidst the reports by The Washington Post of a secret understanding with the United States.

title: ATM Cash-Loading Staff Siphon Off Rs 1.38 Crore In Bengaluru
content: More than Rs 1 crore intended for ATM deposits was allegedly siphoned off by employees of a cash-loading company in Bengaluru.

title: Goa Considers Australia-Like Social Media Ban For Children Below 16
content: Goa is considering an Australia-like social media ban for children, as concerns grow over the risks of such use to their mental health in a nation with more than a billion internet users.

title: Gujarat Anti-Terror Squad Arrests UP Man, 22, With Jihadist Literature
content: In a coordinated operation, the Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) and Navsari Police have arrested a 22-year-old man for allegedly conspiring to commit anti-national activities and terrorist acts.

title: Why Not Sell Assets Of Accused To Compensate Acid Attack Victims? Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court on Tuesday questioned why all assets of acid attack accused cannot be auctioned to provide compensation to victims, highlighting the need for higher, more effective financial rehabilitation.

title: India-EU Summit 2026 LIVE: Delivered 'Mother Of All' Trade Deals With India, Says EU Chief
content: India-EU Summit LIVE Updates: India and the EU have concluded negotiations on the much-awaited Free Trade Agreement (FTA), and the announcement of the conclusion of talks will be made at the 16th India-EU Summit.

title: Video: European Council Chief Antonia Costa Flaunts OCI Card As India, EU Seal Trade Deal
content: European Council President Antonio Luis Santos da Costa shared a light moment when he unexpectedly took out his OCI (Overseas Citizen of India) card and spoke about his Goan roots.

title: Luxury Cars, Wines, Medicines: What Will Be Cheaper After India-EU Pact
content: The sealing of the Free Trade Agreement between India and the European Union after an 18-year wait will bring joy to many, connoisseurs of wine and whiske, and automobile enthusiasts, among them.

title: Punjab, Haryana Chief Ministers Discuss Water Issue, But Deadlock Remains
content: The SYL canal dispute is a decades-old interstate water dispute between Punjab and Haryana over the sharing of water from the Ravi and Beas rivers.

title: Cricket, Beer, Fight Over Lighter And Then Death In Bengaluru Car Crash
content: A 33-year-old man was killed in Bengaluru after a drunken argument following a cricket match escalated into violence, ending with one of the men ramming his SUV into a tree while the other clung to the vehicle.

title: Rare New Flowering Plant Discovered In Nagaland's Community Protected Forest
content: In a striking reminder that India's biodiversity continues to reveal new surprises even in the 21st century, a community-protected forest in Nagaland has yielded a previously unknown species of flowering plant

title: Federal Agents To Support US Security Operations At Winter Olympics In Italy
content: Agents from the divisive Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) will help support US security operations for the Winter Olympic Games in Italy next month

title: "I Was Everyone's Child": Survivor Born In Concentration Camp Shares Story
content: Now 81, Ilana Kantorowicz Shalem is among the youngest Holocaust survivors. She survived only because she was born when the Nazi leadership was in disarray as the war was ending. Otherwise, she most certainly would have been killed.

title: How Donald Trump's Threats Are Impacting Greenland's Tourism
content: At first, Trump's public interest in Greenland attracted global attention, which came as a boon for local businesses. However, the current situation has made the outlook for tourism far more uncertain.

title: India-EU Seal Historic Trade Deal Amid Global Turmoil. Why It Matters
content: In a moment heavy with symbolism and strategic consequence, India and the European Union sealed a long-awaited Free Trade Agreement (FTA)

title: Bangladeshi Workers Lured To Russia For Job Forced To Fight Ukraine War
content: An Associated Press investigation found that Bangladeshi workers were lured to Russia under the false promise of civilian work, only to be thrust into the chaos of combat in Ukraine. Many were threatened with violence, imprisonment or death.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Muratalla climbs after IBF title defense over Cruz
content: the lightweights were separated by one punch on CompuBox, but Muratalla appeared to land the harder punches . it was the first time that the lightweight champion fought past 10 rounds in his seven-fight pro career . he moves up to no. 4 from no. 6 in the ESPN lightweight rankings .

title: UCLA's Bob Chesney: Coal miner, bartender, coach of the Bruins
content: new coach Bob Chesney has mined coal, slung Red Bull and vodkas behind a bar . he has worked every on-field job from strength coach to special teams coach . "he's the kind of guy I want to get in the foxhole with," athletic director says .

title: The two sides of Mitch Marner's return home to Toronto
content: the Toronto Maple Leafs honor Mitch Marner in a tribute video . the star player spent nine seasons with the team . he left his hometown team and joined the Vegas Golden Knacks . marner's car was stolen and his address was leaked online .

title: Year of the Fire Horse: Man City celebrate Lunar New Year with special kit
content: a special-edition jersey is released to celebrate the Lunar New Year . the prematch shirt is covered in hand-drawn horse motifs in a traditional Chinese ink and watercolour style . manufacturers say that the artwork embodies power, movement and relentless drive .

title: After Clippers' 15-3 run, fan follows through on eating his words
content: the LA Clippers defeated the Brooklyn Nets 126-89 on a 15-3 stretch dating back to December . fans remembered Flom's post on X as soon as the final buzzer sounded . he stayed true to his word, saying he would indeed eat a printout of his post .

title: Super Bowl betting buzz: How one bettor's $100 bet could turn into $310,000
content: our super bowl betting buzz file aims to provide fans a look at the sports betting stories leading up to the big game . the matchup for super Bowl LX is set with the Seattle Seahawks favored over the new England Patriots to take home the Lombardi Trophy .

title: MLS, Polymarket join forces in prediction markets
content: the NHL became the first major professional U.S. league to announce a deal with prediction markets in October last year . prediction markets such as Polymarket and Kalshi allow users to trade on the yes/no outcome of events .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Cole Palmer open to Man United move
content: the 23-year-old is reportedly unsettled living in London . midfielder Bruno Fernandes is prepared to extend his contract at old trafford . a decision is expected to be made at the end of the season . click here for all the latest transfer news .

title: Despite a 'disaster' debut season, Jets still believe in Aaron Glenn
content: Aaron Glenn woke up at 3:30 a.m., unable to sleep because of the anticipation of his first practice . he was on the verge of tears when those temporary bleachers chanted, "J-E-T-S! Jets!" a week later, a wistful Glenn said, "it hit me, and it hit me pretty hard"

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: South Carolina slips
content: the new AP top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the results of a pair of SEC showdowns shuffled the top of the rankings . south Carolina Gamecocks dropped one spot to no. 3 .

title: Men's Bracketology: The Big Ten drought could (really, finally) end

title: The 10 NBA teams that have the most to trade for Giannis
content: the 18-26 Bucks are on pace for their worst record in 10 years . they are in danger of picking in the lottery f1 . if Antetokounmpo is drafted, the Bucks will face a franchise-altering decision .

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: Arizona unanimous No. 1, Nebraska at historic No. 5
content: this is the fifth time in AP poll history that three teams have started 20-0 . all three are in the poll for a second consecutive week . the top 5 has a new face after Purdue dropped out of the top 10 entirely with two straight losses .

title: ⚾ MLB breakout teams: Who's better in 2026?
content: a breakout team is a club that wins at least 10 more games than what would be expected by its established level of play . we'll use wins per 162 games for the previous two seasons, while giving double weight to the most recent season . last season, the highest baseline win level was the Los Angeles Dodgers .
